title: Use Vertical Space
description: Install shelves or hanging pots to maximize vertical space.
details: Vertical gardening helps you make the most of walls and fences by using stacked planters or hanging pots. It's perfect for balconies and patios.

title: Choose the Right Containers
description: Use pots with proper drainage for healthy roots.
details: Plastic, ceramic, or terracotta containers work well, but ensure they have drainage holes. Self-watering containers can reduce maintenance.

title: Start with Herbs
description: Basil, mint, and parsley are easy to grow.
details: Herbs grow quickly, donâ€™t require much space, and can be harvested regularly. Perfect for windowsills and balcony edges.

title: Use Compost
description: Recycle food waste into plant nutrition.
details: Composting is eco-friendly and enriches soil. Use kitchen scraps like peels, coffee grounds, and eggshells to boost plant growth.

title: Water Smartly
description: Avoid overwatering and water in the early morning.
details: Morning watering helps reduce evaporation. Check soil moisture before watering again to avoid root rot.

title: Grow in Raised Beds
description: Raised beds improve drainage and soil quality.
details: Raised beds warm up faster in spring and allow you to control soil composition, making them ideal for urban gardens.

title: Use Mulch
description: Mulch retains moisture and suppresses weeds.
details: Organic mulch like straw or bark chips keeps soil cool, reduces watering needs, and prevents weed growth.

title: Maximize Sunlight
description: Place plants where they get at least 6 hours of sun.
details: Observe your space throughout the day and move containers as needed to ensure your plants get enough sunlight.

title: Grow Edible Flowers
description: Nasturtiums and pansies add color and are edible.
details: Edible flowers not only beautify your garden but can also be used in salads and as garnishes.

title: Practice Companion Planting
description: Pair plants that benefit each other.
details: Some plants, like basil and tomatoes, grow better together and can help deter pests naturally.

title: Rotate Crops
details: Rotating crops prevents soil depletion and reduces the risk of disease and pests.

title: Collect Rainwater
description: Use rain barrels to water your garden.
details: Collecting rainwater is eco-friendly and can reduce your water bill. Use it to water your plants during dry spells.

title: Fertilize Naturally
description: Use compost tea or fish emulsion.
details: Natural fertilizers provide nutrients without chemicals. Apply regularly for healthy, productive plants.

title: Grow Microgreens
details: Microgreens can be grown indoors year-round and harvested in as little as two weeks.

title: Pest Control Naturally
description: Use neem oil or introduce ladybugs.
details: Avoid harsh chemicals by using natural pest control methods like neem oil or beneficial insects.
